Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay..”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for five days with my mother and had an excellent stay. When we first arrived the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room I admit could have done with some redecoration but I don't see how this affects the quality of anybody's trip. We enjoyed a view of the Vatican from the balcony and the room was comfortable and clean. For breakfast there was a great selection of food which was all very tasty. The evening meals were also very good and reasonably priced. The location of the hotel was quiet and a tad far out of town. However we never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for a bus and the metro was very easy to get used to. Once you know your routes in and out of the city centre everything was pretty simple. The hotel also offers a shuttle bus if you're less adventurous with negotiating public transport. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return again, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine W
Reviews.Content: Following our sightseeing trip to Rome we thought we should compliment the friendly helpful staff during our stay .The Hotel was clean ,comfortable and amenities good. The food a lovely continental breakfast and plenty of it .Also you could arrange a packed lunch to take out with you a bonus when out sightseeing.We ate in the restaurant on two nights and the food was good and reasonable in price.There had been comments it was a little far out of the city but it is on the main bus route and a quick ten minute trip on the bus to the vatican. The rooms clean ,daily maid service ,a fridge and a bonus of a balcony. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so rude.......”
Reviews.Author: football60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 2011 with cosmos tour group but would never stay there again. While having breakfast with our tour group my 12 year old son dropped his scrambled eggs to the ground. Before he even had a chance to tell me a very rude waitress came over to him demanding why that had happened. We were so embarrassed. I speak Italian and could understand the staff of the hotel when they made fun of our American friends on our tour group. If you do happen to stay at this hotel there is a nice pizza bar down the road. They have nice pasta and pizza dishes, much better than the hotel. This hotel is in the middle of nowhere and has old rooms which smelt of smoke. We only stayed two nights but still couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A 2-3 stars hotels listed as 4 stars...”
Reviews.Author: marcelc
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this hotels got a 4 stars rating. Not only that the rooms are old and in need of restoration but they are very poorly designed (the bathroom especially, if you are using the toilet you will have your feet under the sink and the shower cabin is sooo small that you will always touch the cold walls with your back - honestly speaking someone larger wouldn't even fit in that shower cabin). The walls are so thin that you can practically hear EVERYTHING what other people were talking / doing. The door closing mechanisms (pretty unique nowadays) are really hard to use. There were no carpets on the floor (but at least they provided slippers). No tea / coffee making options (it was listed that in the Executive rooms you have that option!!??). We only got plastic glasses in the day we checked in. They were picked up with the cleaning in the next day and they were NEVER replaced and there were no other glasses available in the room. The breakfast is ok for 1-2 days but since you get the SAME food everyday (1 type of cheese, 1 type of ham, 1 type of salami = SAME type everyday) it gets very annoying. As a curiosity, even if you get some fruits for breakfast there are no vegetables at all (no mustard also even if you get hotdogs and fried bacon), The hotel is pretty far (20 mins metro + 10 mins bus waiting + 10 mins bus ride) from center of Rome and pretty hard to find. So unless you plan to leave the hotel in the morning and come back at night it's a bad choice in this aspect too. The staff was helpful and friendly, though, Overall, a bad choice in all aspects. Maybe if you don't find anything else and you need a cheap room for a night it could work, but bring earplugs with you.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: kayledson
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed on two occasions at the Pineta Palace, the first was part of a Cosmos Tour we were expecting 4 star and we were really disappointed as the hotel was in a suburb of Rome not walking distance it was serviced by bus and taxis anyway we were in the basic rooms and we were terribly disappointed. The rooms were old and we could hear pretty well everything that was going on in other rooms. The breakfast was good though. Anyway on our arrival back after our tour we still had 2 more nights there. Not wanting to stay in the same type of room we asked if we could upgrade into a superior room. We were introduced to "seventh heaven" there were one bedroom suites with Kingsize beds and a queen sized sofa, so we took 2 rooms we were 4 women travelling. The rooms were fANTASTIC and the bathrooms excellent. The upgrade was Euros60 per day per room so not too expensive. Having the better rooms the hotel staff became very obliging and couldn't do enough for us. The apparently are updating the hotel as time and money allows, but fore me 7th heaven was the way to go, we also had amazing views of Rome..

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lulu3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-Cosmos bus tour. We booked on-line well in advance and got a great rate! We weren't expecting too much after reading the reviews on trip advisor, so we were pleasantly surprised with our accommodations! Our rooms were older, but clean. We all had balconies, but had to be careful not to shut the patio doors, as once the patio door closes behind you, you can't get back inside your room!! The doors only open from the inside. The included breakfast was great! Reception was friendly and very helpful. We arrived at the hotel late in the evening and were pleasantly surprised to find the lobby restaurant still open and willing to make all 6 of us pizzas! Very accommodating! We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Europe Tour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiger96_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to our Cosmos Tour leaving from here. Found the front desk service wasn't very helpful (almost like we were an inconvenience to them). We asked the staff how to get to the Metro and they told us to get the #49 but didn't tell us they sold tickets so we ended up walking to the Metro instead. Food was good though and once we worked out how to get into town it was very convenient. Stayed for three nights in total.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt stay through choice, but was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: TheWebsters4
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to go to Pinewood Hotel, but as review we had to be transferred to Pineta due to Pinewood not having our booking (or so they say!) We arrived here feeling a bit put out to say the least (not Pinetas fault) - it was raining very heavy. We were checked in very quickly by a lovely receptionist - he explained that the room he was giving was the very last on in the hotel and apologised that it didnt have a walk in shower!!, to be honest all we wanted to do was to drop off our luggage etc, freshen up and then get into Rome (after all we didnt come to Rome to stay in a hotel all day!) The room we had was a little outdated, very small bathroom and the cobwebs on the walls looked older than Rome! the bed was comfy though and it was very quiet as we were on the end of the corridor. We had all we needed for a good nights sleep after walking all day. The breakfast was very nice, full cooked if you wanted it or continental if you didnt. Unlimted tea and coffee etc and was very nice. So, even thought we didnt book here by choice, we found it adequate for our needs. When you have been walking around Rome all day, all you need is somewhere to rest your weary feet! Most if the accommodation in the outskirts is pretty standard and you get what you pay for. Have a lovely Roman holiday x

Reviews.Title: “Poorly designed bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: olyottb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night as part of a Cosmos tour. The room was comfortable and clean and the breakfast good. Our only comment would be that they need to redesign their bathrooms. The bathroom was very small and a huge square washbasin overlapped the toilet! Consequently even a small person would have difficulty sitting on the toilet comfortably. It would have been better to have put the toilet where the bidet was - or better still change the washbasins to smaller ones.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: suzie0
Reviews.Content: Great location just one bus ride into centre of Rome. nice and clean, but staff not helpful and very noisy you can here everything in every room. The breakfast was terrible lots of tours in at the same time so it was noisy and the staff couldn't keep up with the demand

Reviews.Title: “Third time in Rome and the worst 4 star hotel we have stayed”
Reviews.Author: Dflloyd
Reviews.Content: Very basic !! Walls very thin and noisy what we herd is to embarrassing to even mention, reception staff very rude and abrupt , break fast staff are very good though they need to be commended

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: gogo65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here pre and post our Cosmos tour. The hotel is reasonable, breakfast is reasonable, it is a distance form the city, however we were happy to catch the bus and metro ourselves There is really no where else to eat around here, I would recommend using this hotel purely for sleeping, spend your whole days in Rome, return to sleep and get up and go again the next day. Staff were quite rude and were no interested in helping tour group clients at all, luckily any info we needed we got off the internet!.

Reviews.Title: “Descent deal”
Reviews.Author: e k
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Pineta Palace on early August. Of course it is not a 4 stars hotel but on the other hand it's much more cheaper than a 4 stars hotel. Nice room, polite service, nice breakfast, far away from the city center. Just don't buy a drink at the bar. I paid 45 euros the first day in order to go there from the city center and 16 euros the third day. Taxi drivers in Rome are criminals. Tell them to switch the taxi meter on every time you catch a taxi. If they say no call the police.

Reviews.Title: “48 Hours that just wouldn't go by.”
Reviews.Author: Dullege
Reviews.Content: The Pineta Palace Hotel was the first hotel in our Cosmos Tour. I poured over the past reviews and had substantial fears. My impressions were similar to many negative reviews but differed in some ways. When we got into our rooms there were hairs in the bathtub and the bathroom floor was dirty. The rest of the room was clean. We went down to the bar and ordered some food and drinks. The female at the bar seemed unhappy to be there but everyone has bad days. From there I went to the gym. The gym, not at all as envisioned on their corporate website, was completely insufficient for any kind of decent workout. But it's there. The hotel is, as some have stated, a significant distance from the centre of Rome. That can be a positive or negative depending on your needs. Unlike some others I found the staff to be courteous and helpful. Although wi-fi is widely advertised you have to pay some amount of money to use it for periods of times. The in-hotel kitchen works hours that did not jive with our tour. Ending the day at 2pm and having the kitchen not start cooking until 630pm forced my wife and I to find alternatives. There is a supermarket very nearby which we frequented over the 48hrs. Prices for food and drink in the hotel are what is to be expected, i.e. hotel markup. This markup is, in my estimation, also attributed to the lack of options coinciding with it's rural location. There is a bus service into Rome which we didn't use. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear people on all sides and above and below you moving around throughout the day and night. The decor is directly out of the 1980's and we didn't use the blankets for fear of smallpox (joke). Although we really didn't use the blankets because they seemed very ill-maintained. There was one chair on the balcony that overlooked several garbage piles on other properties. The key-system is evidence of the lack of reinvestment into the hotel. With your key you get the pleasure of carrying a cigerette-pack sized piece of metal. Satellite TV is non-existent. I'm sure that the 7th floor is quite nice, no other floor is. The real question is: Knowing what I know now, would I ever stay there again independently? The answer is no, I would not stay here again given any other option. While the staff were nice the hotel sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: realtraveltips
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel from June 19-20 of 2011 as part of a Cosmos Tour. The Hotel was about 20-25 minutes from main attractions like the Vatican and other tourist attractions. It had the basics; double beds, safe, refridgerator, private toilet and shower (very small shower), and TV. I found the shower to be a bit small, but most showers in Europe are small. The balcony was nice but the view of the city was a bit far as you can see from one of the photos in the video. The Room Key was very large and heavy. One tip I can give anyone staying here is to leave the room key with the front desk when you visit town. Overall it wasn't a bad room (it was clean), but not a high quality hotel. The hotel was about a 30 minute drive from the airport (FCO). Airport transport cost me 30 euro's for just me and my 1 bag. I added photo's of the room I stayed in and some photo's of the view from my room. Hopefully this will be helpful to others who are trying to determine if they want to stay at this hotel. I also have a 2 minute video about this hotel room on my Youtube account (iheart2travel) or search Hotel Pineta Palace on Youtube.com.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: FromBrno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not 4-stars. I guess weak 3-stars. But price is good, breakfasts too. Room was large but with thin walls and there were a little bit noisy fans outside next the bus parking. That is why balcony doors had to be closed all night and this was not enough. Far from city center but with good public transport (bus 146 to Battistini tube station). But we were there when public transport staff were on strike ;-(

Reviews.Title: “unhappy”
Reviews.Author: flowers73
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this motel on 2 separate occassions and both times found the staff unhelpful and quite rude at times and none of them appeared happy in their jobs . The rooms were quite basic and the beds were quite hard, and not great for sleeping . In one of the rooms we stayed in the toilet was loacted so close to the hand basin so that you nearly had to be double jointed to sit on the toilet and your legs ended up under the basin . Also the price for Internet acces was very expensive and when we made a comment we were trold that it was because it was a Swiss company that supplied the access

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sena_gooneratne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Cosmos tour. The place was too far away from the city. You had to take a bus - the stop was far away. The rooms were pretty ordinary but must admit they were clean. I think the walls were very thin as we heard noises from other rooms. We liked and enjoyed the breakfast - which was good. Avoid the internet at all costs. It cost me 10 euros for half an hour. Which is an rip off and an absolute disgrace. The reception staff ( other than for one young gentleman ) were rude, obnoxious and terrible unhelpful. It is best not to talk to them as they tend to look away anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: t2243
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because my Cosmos tour group was beginning from here. I also stayed several nights after the tour. I was expecting a modern, classy hotel. It's clean, it has the amenities required, but not a great hotel. Location is a long way from tourist attractions. Staff at all times were not friendly, and did not go out ot their way to help. It almost seemed a bother that they had to serve me. Food was really good! Breakfast is a great selection, and tasty. Internet is expensive, and the one computer was sloooow. Noise was ridiculous at times. Walls were VERY thin. I had to yell at one point to tell the people right outside my door to quieten down. I would not stay here again. I would only recommend this hotel if you don't have any great expectations of service, and location. Otherwise, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I had the worst experience ever....”
Reviews.Author: tkanello
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed there for 4 days. The room was dirty. There were ants in the room. There was a bad smell coming from the bathroom. ( probobly the sewer system). The breakfast was Ok but the staff , mainly at the reception was impolite. It was far from the center and we paid 15-20 euro for taxi - for one way. There was also a lot of noice in the hotel and we couldn't sleep. This was not a 4 star hotel One star the most. We are never travelling again with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic, Far from City....but clean”
Reviews.Author: polotab
Reviews.Content: Location was bad if you want to see Rome and any part of a city. Too far outside of town. Rooms were very basic and I didn't like this place at all...on first stay. However I changed my mind after staying in other worse places around Italy. Upon the 2nd stay at end of our Cosmos tour, I was actually ok with this place. The bottom line, at least it was CLEAN!! I can tolerate few to zero ammenities, if the place is sanitary. The door locks were confusing and in one of our rooms, it appeared to have been broken into by the busted lock and side of the door kicked in. Breakfast was good and plentiful with huge banquet room facilities to accomodate large number of guests and tour groups. Overall, this place is ok and can grow on a person. I've definitely stayed at worse places.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? Palace? No way!”
Reviews.Author: Ferrri
Reviews.Content: We also stayed at the end of a Cosmos trip after the appraisal forms had been handed in. While the room was clean and the breakfast OK and we slept fine it is definitely not a place I would have chosen to stay to see Rome. It was a long walk to the metro. We chose to take a taxi straight to St Peters because it was unlikely to cost much more than taking a cab to the nearest station. The room was very cheaply and poorly built so it didn't feel comfortable. The desk staff did their best to ignore the customers and chatted among themselves. The internet was expensive. If you have a choice, don't stay here to see Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmos should listen to their customers”
Reviews.Author: Credo505
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Cosmos tour after the tour evaluation forms had been handed in! Two lots of our party departed immediately when they saw the standard and location.The rooms are old and drab although they are clean. The sound proofing is non-existent. Some of the rooms have such badly designed bathrooms that the toilet is fitted partly under the hand basin.On arrival it appeared that the aircon was working well but the whole system was turned off overnight despite temperatures of 35 degrees. Transport into central Rome is difficult The hotel courtesy bus only goes early morning and late evening. It is complicated to find the bus stop to get a bus that connects with the metro. Some of our party got lost returning at night and found themselves in a very dubious area in the dark. There is only one local eating establishment . The meal was cold and ordinary. One order didn't even arrive which was probably a blessing.The local supermarket is a much better bet. The breakfast was horrible.The taste of the yoghurt was indescribable. The bowl of peaches obviously had pineapple juice in it, a mystery that was solved when we saw a can of pears being added later on. How long it was since a fresh start had been made was anyone's guess. The internet charge was huge. We stayed in 3 star hotels in Europe for 4 weeks and this was the worst. A big company like Cosmos should not be using a place with such poor facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: pottertrotter
Reviews.Content: Came here with a group of friends looking forward to a great stay in a beautiful historical city -- how could you mess that up right? Very easily. By staying at this hotel. Its unbelievably far away from central Rome - which doesn't have to be a negative. But the difficult transport links is. You have to take a bus and metro into the central which is fine. Coming back, buses stop far away from the hotel and the walk at night is not pleasant/is very creepy. The room itself, the walls are gossamer thin. I could hear everything my friends said, and vice versa. You can hear someone using the toilet!!! TMI, in my opinion. Beds are uncomfortable, the rate they charge internet is bloodmoney, toilets are old and dirty. The buffet breakfast isn't edible.The service of the hotel - during the day, the hotel staff are okay. They don't go out of their way to please you, but if you tell them something they'll comprehend. Night time is completely different. The night staff are lazy, rude, ignorant, complacent and downright annoying. This might come off as a rant but honestly, I do travel a lot and not on big budgets - often staying at hostels. The tragedy here is that my 15euro/night hostel bed trumps this hotel room, by a lightyear. Please heed my advice and avoid. And I hope all the tour group operators heed my advice, because you will keep giving them business and people will continuously be ripped off. Doesn't matter how much you spend or how cheap it is, I wouldn't stay if they paid me to.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Vels79
Reviews.Content: We travelled with out 11 month old but for the location we liked this hotel very much. Good value for money. It was a little difficult to reach this Hotel from Ciampino Airport. The ATAC bus stop is walkable and connects to the city center and the hotel offers shuttle service (for 3 euros) to the city center thrice every day. Breakfast is good, rooms were clean though the bath fitings might have to be renewed. We had a very good view of the St.Peter's Basilica from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and staff unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: QPRgirl
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews and thought how bad can it be, after all it is a four star hotel? I wish now i had listened. The first night was ok because we were tired from travelling but the second night we thought someone was in the room with us. The noise from the other rooms was horrendous. The staff gave the cold shoulder everytime we tried to talk to them and when they did speak to us they acted as if we were bothering them and they just wanted to get rid of us. They even gave us incorrect directions to the local buses and church! we did however find our own way around and Rome is really beautiful it is just nowhere near this hotel. This hotel is a bus ride and a train ride away from central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quite far from central Rome”
Reviews.Author: verbalme
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a Cosmos tour in May 2009. The reception staff could be more friendly as I had asked for a map and directions to central Rome. With some boredom, they pulled out a map and started explaining how to get here and there. The room was all right since I was not expecting too much. Everything worked though the shower curtain didn't prevent water from spilling over onto the bathroom floor. The only complaint I had was its location - located in the suburbs. You had to walk out of the hotel to take a bus to an interchange and take the train from there. Alternatively an express bus near the hotel (5 to 10 mins walk) takes you directly into central Rome via Vatican City, it's around 30 minutes. Going to central Rome was all right, but going back to the hotel was slightly more difficult as the bus goes through a different street. Thankfully we asked the locals who were more than willing to help us out.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, dirty hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: SoloChick09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the begining and end of a Cosmos tour, so if I wasnt on this tour, there is NO WAY I would have continued to stay here. It is in the middle of no where and its too hard to get into the center of Rome. The rooms are old and dirty, the bathroom even dirtier with terrible shower curtains (my only just hanging onto the wall) and the walls are paper thin so you can here everything in the rooms beside you. They advised there was a pool and unless it was very well hidden I couldnt find it. All the staff (especially the front desk and bar staff) are very rude, none of them know how to smile and they all give you the impression that you are just a bother to them - it is your job people!!!!!!!!!!! DO NOT eat food offered at the bar. I had a cheese and tomato sandwich, you would think not hard but honestly the worst sandwich I have ever had. Stale, soggy bread, old tomato and tasteless mozzarella. I ate in the resturant for dinner once and it wasnt too bad, the breakfast wasnt too bad either - except the coffee. The only other place nearby to eat is a little resturant down the road which all the staff recommend, but it is awful too - dont go there. My friend ordered the hamburger and chips and thats all he got was the patty - no bun or salad....... The other thing I found really gross was the big bins just out the front of the hotel. They stank sooooo bad and always seemed full - yuk!! This hotel needs a total overhall, and new staff or better still knocked down. I would not recommend staying here and I hope Cosmos seriously considers changing their hotel option for Rome. There are cheaper nicer hotels closer to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: LafoMamone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 stars, it should have 2 and a half at max. Paperthin-walls, you almost clearly hear conversations in the next room. Walls at the room should have been repainted about 4 years ago, the paint is falling off. The toilet is placed so your head ends up on the sink. Insane solution for a bathrom. They are advertising as they have wireless internett connection included in the price, but you have to pay some blood money to get connected. 88Euros for a week, with good connection, or 18Euros for a day with a crappy one. The only good thing about thisone is the room service and the view from the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and essential services available, nearby scammers confirmed.”
Reviews.Author: rsoania
Reviews.Content: On my first day, I had a similar experience to another post here, in which a robbery took place nearby. Two men in street clothes pulled up next to me asking to see my passport - one had very rapidly flashed a badge that had the Italian colors. I immediately fished out my photocopied passport and gave it to them. I said that "If you wish to see the original, please accompany me to my hotel room." They immediately said it's okay, and that there have been problems nearby they were tying to sting. I encouraged them to accompany me to the hotel, yet they declined. I'm glad I did this, as it seems others may have not been so fortunate. Otherwise, the hotel gives excellent value, which is compensated by the efficient ATAC.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the robbery”
Reviews.Author: TassieTusker
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay at this motel (which overall is okay) beware of nearby Pizza Pub and surrounding streets. We were robbed by people posing as police less than 100 metres from the motel. The assailants seemed to be aware of our movements and were prepared for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, good diner”
Reviews.Author: MWGH
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Perfect shuttle service to the city center. And the diner in this hotel is really good, bud the atmosphere in the restaurant terrible. The service was average bud the hotel needs a complete makeover. The rooms were clean though. What bottered us was the noise at night, the walls are so thin! At the end I would recommend this Hotel. Esspecially because of the price we paid. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, just off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: lastangel
Reviews.Content: it is a good location for tourist groups. the restaurant and free meals are exceptional. this hotel is not a place for a restful retreat. sound resonates and you will end up rising and sleeping on the schedule of the crowd. you can get a taxi to the hotel from the airport for approx. 50eu. the bus is nearby to downtown and the train station. approx.. 20 minutes to termina. if you are into nightclubs.. pyramid district is about 20-30 eu by taxi. it is not as

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and not too far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan79
Reviews.Content: Like others, I spent three nights at the Pineta Palace during a Cosmos tour: two nights at the beginning of the tour and one at the end. While the hotel was a bit of a distance from downtown, we had the hotel call us a taxi. It took 20 minutes and cost 20 euro for a ride to the National Museum of Rome. The taxi driver was very social and took us on a little side trip to show us some sites on the way -- we didn't feel taken at all. The return cab was just 17 euro (and this driver refused the tip we offered). But back to the hotel: I found the rooms spacious enough, comfortable enough, and clean. The first room had the bizarre bathroom others described with the sink overlapping the toilet. The second room had a large bathroom. In the first room I did not hear my neighbors but my neighbor's voices and the sound from their TV was noticable n the second room; but it was tolerable and I soon drowned it out. The safe in the second room had no English instructions. The desk quickly sent someone up with the instructions but the battery in the safe was dead but was fixed within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jillitalia
Reviews.Content: A bit far from the city center, but clean, comfortable, and safe. There is an excellent pizzeria within walking distance (Pizzeria Mica Male), and a tabacchi right down the street. Great bar.

Reviews.Title: “So dirty I left early”
Reviews.Author: Match0
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general was dirty.. but the worse part was that the blanket had many pubic hairs stuck to it and the pillows smelled. It looked as if it hadnt been washed in months. The rest of the room was dirty, so I sprayed disinfectant and walked with flip flops. The housekeeper came early one morning and when we asked her to come back by 9am, she said she would come the next day. She didnt come back. I booked 4 days and decided lose the $ and go to another hotel. The hotel was far from Rome, but the bus stop was about 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Could do with a good clean”
Reviews.Author: hippodreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of a Cosmos tour. The rooms were fairly basic, which is what we expected, but we were very disappointed with the level of cleanliness throughout the hotel and in the room itself. Our pillows were dirty and stained. I had to cover mine with my travel towel. This was probably the worst hotel compared to the other included in our tour. The room did have a little balcony so we were able to do some washing, and there was a supermarket nearby too. On our last night we discovered the hotel ran a shuttle bus into the city, which was pretty good for 4 euros per person. The food was okay, although small servings, which again on an escorted tour is bound to occur. I don't think I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Off-the-beaten-path; noisy”
Reviews.Author: ueser
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a group, and so we did not select this hotel. The fact that it was out of the way from central Rome was mitigated by the fact that we had charter bus service back & forth. The rooms were a decent size & clean, however, the walls are thin & conversations are readily transmitted. The air conditioning functionned sporadically. Breakfast buffet was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of barking dogs”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a residential area and the italian like to keep their dog OUTSIDE ! I was on the 4th floor and the dog barking keep us awake half the night , you can't really blame the hotel but that is just how it is.. the window and wall are not very sound proof so even with the window shut , you can still hear them barking . As for the hotel , everything is adequate and the location is only a short bus ride and couple of metro stops away from Vatican , prefect area for base to do the city , and if you are driving to Rome , you can park at the hotel parking safely for 10 euro a day , which is not bad in rome. All in all , I would stay there again but I will insist on staying on upper floor to stay above the barking dogs .

Reviews.Title: “Good base for seeing Rome and the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: spirochaete
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. We paid around 50 Euros a night for room and breakfast. The small restaurant downstairs was of a high standard and better value than those in the city. The Valentine dinner was really enjoyable with about 6 courses for about 35 euros. The hotel shuttle into the city saves a lot on taxi fares and is conveniantly timed.

Reviews.Title: “you can hear your neighbor fart!”
Reviews.Author: Dacrow1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of the way and hard to find. The walls are very thin and you can hear your neighbors conversations from 3 rooms down. I heard the bathroom as if it was in my room. The balconies are nice and there is a cute bartender who works in the bar on the evenings who is really nice. The hotel staff are all nice. The rooms were yucky and the tv hardly worked. the bed linen is worse than that at a best western. 4 1/2 stars how? i have stayed at motel 6's with more luxury. The buffet was nasty at best. The eggs were so runny and I never seen that dark of eggs in all my life

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: hollynpuss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pineta Palace for three nights in July as it was part of a Cosmos tour. Unfortunately I think that my idea of a palace and their idea must be completely different. The staff did not treat us like 'royalty' in fact they were almost indifferent to us. It was as though they thought, it's only a tour group they will be in and out in a few days anyway, why bother, and they didn't. They did not look happy in their jobs. We only had one meal there which was just as well because I think that we got served special coach party food. We had some Gnnocchi, (in an effort to call it Italian cuisine), a crumbed chicken pattie,soggy veg, and for dessert a plate of fruit to divide up between a table of eight. Not what I would call Italian food. The only saving grace was that wine was included, it helped to fill a void. The room were a good size and clean, however our bathroom had the largest hand basin in the world (slight exageration) great if you did want to do you smalls in the sink but it meant that the sink was located over the toilet. Hard to imagine and even harder to use especially if you suffer from a bad back or are larger than average size. My husband had to use the toilet locate downstairs. It is a little out of the way but that is okay, To go into Rome we used the hotel shuttle, then coming back we used the metro system, which was very cheap but that then required a further 20 minute walk along a very busy road. If I was an independant traveller I would not use this hotel again I would perhaps try and find something closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: travel1987
Reviews.Content: just come back from a long weekend at this hotel with my boyfriend. i absolutely loved rome and for the purpose(being a place to rest) his hotel was suitable especially for the money. it is kinda out of the way from the centre of the city. but more than do-able!!!!! we couldnt find the hotel at first but once we did it was very comfortable and the staff were extremely helfpul. we explored the whole of rome and it was a comfort to come back to this hotel. the food around the area is much more afordable too, we found it very expensive eating in the centre of rome. all together though i enjoyed my stay and the metro and bus was a experience not a inconvieiance. if you are going for a short trip tho would recommend staying closer to the city tho as you will have more time to fit everything in.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: FirstTimer70
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 3 nights as part of a tour group. It is a little way out of Rome but the hotel shuttle is cheap to use. Unfortunately I found the staff on the front desk very hard to extract information out of. It was like pulling teeth and they only ever gave the minimal info they had to. Apart from their service my room was clean and very comfortable with a lovely balcony overlooking the back streets.

Reviews.Title: “rooms ok but very NOISY”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in july of 2008 for 4 days. 2 very bad days and 2 very good days. this is a tour hotel, the first two days there it was full of very loud noisy kids, hotel made litte effort to keep it quiet at 2 in the morning, business is business. located in the middle of no where but fairly easy to get downtown if you can get the directions on how to from the hotel clerk. rooms were small but clean, the beds were ok, no complaint there. would not let us sit on the out door patio if we did not buy something from the bar, seriously. very good restaurant called Mica Mikes very close. behind and near the hospital is a street with a market and cheap internet, much cheaper than the hotel's. would never stay here if not on a tour

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: d0526
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pineta Palace was an amazing find. My boyfriend and I weren't sure what to expect exactly because of the price we paid! The concierge was courteous and answered all of our questions about the city! I would recommend this hotel for everyone. Our room was nice with a balcony. The shuttle to the city was quite an experience....but apparently all Italians drive like that. I suggest taking their shuttle service at a minimal charge, because its quite a far walk from the city centre. (Blistered, swollen feet the first day was not what I was expecting from our walk) Overall, our experience was wonderful, and we will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: itravellots52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two daughters had to stay overnight in Rome after a cruise. We chose this hotel because it was one of few that could accomodate 4 people. We booked a Junior Suite on the executive 7th floor. The price was 180 euros, which was seemed tobe reasonable for four people. After reading the reviews we were not sure what to expect; but the room was beautiful, the hotel was quiet and the staff were helpful. Yes it is 15 euro charge for taxi to the city, but we were expecting that so no surprises!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a hike to get to.”
Reviews.Author: Daydreammer
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire, or we wouldn't have stayed so far out. WE needed to take the subway then a bus to reach the hotel from the train station. There is a shuttle 3 times a day into Rome, be sure to ask. The breakfast was awesome, lots to pick from and plenty of varitety. The room was adequate, comfortable and clean. The staff was half and half, we felt like a bother or catered to, depending on who was at the desk. The resturant had good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “read the reviews before we went and they are spot on.l”
Reviews.Author: dorothy00
Reviews.Content: this is a very noisy hotel even the smallest sound from above is clear. breakfast is great but early 6.30 to 9.30 and they clear everything at 9.31 staff not over friendly but will help you when asked. far out but we found getting around easy with the four euro ticket for bus and metro. nothing nearby and local resturaunt was awful. rooms basic but clean good 3 star but the noise really is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: kostas15
Reviews.Content: the hottel was terible ... the decoration was very old and bad. the staff was not frienly. and i can't believe how that hotel is 4 stars. i went to 3 stars hotel and it was much much better. the rooms was old and the bathrooms was not Comfortable + it was very awful. some of the staff was not so frienly. this hotel can't be 4 stars. we went to the hotel with other 20 people because we were in a groop and all the people was verry dissaponted. i believe is unccetable the hotel to be 4*. and also the room was very noisy and i could heart every little sound.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: bethrod
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very average and out of town, but that is not our reason for complaining. We stayed there at both ends of our Cosmos tour and on returning to the hotel after our farewell dinner a staff member proceeded to yell at us about the noise we were making in the foyer. Not once but twice slamming a door and yelling at the top of his voice. Now we were a group of middle aged tourists, some families with polite teenage children. It was about 9.30 at night , we were no where near rooms nor were there any other guests in the foyer. We were not yelling but talking and I still can't understand why he couldn't have very nicely asked us would we like to move to another part of the hotel. Diplomacy was not his strong point! We travelled for 6 Months around 15 countries and we were never confronted with such rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not so nice...”
Reviews.Author: tourists2
Reviews.Content: The pictures of Pineta Hotel does not do justice, kind of like false advertising. We had an economy room which was small; walls are very thin (we actually had an ear full of people next door to us making out all night/all morning); only one English speaking (American) channel on the television, which was CNN - this drove us crazy because our favorite shows were played, but they were all in Italian. The breakfast was not bad at all for your typical continental - pastries, eggs, meat, cereal, fruit - very good and edible! Rome is beautiful and my husband and I had a great time. We took tours, shopped, and saw amazing art, the Vatican, the Colliseum, and other historical beauty. Be sure to prepare to take taxis, buses, and shuttles - these are a little far out. As for the natives in Rome - they are not so friendly to tourists, but very select few were nice. Also, on Valentine's day we had reservations at the hotel restaurant in which was set up so lovely and decorative. We were the second couple seated, but was not served appropriately - we walked out and went to another restaurant down the road. We definitely notified management about this. Would we stay here again...? NOT! We don't mean to sound so cynical, this is not our intetion but we wanted to share our experience. Sincerely, Dissatisfied Tourists

Reviews.Title: “Far from it!”
Reviews.Author: VIOLETTA22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Pineta Palace numerous times because of the Cosmos Tours I have been on. It is located in a very remote quiet location and the only efficient type of transport is taking a taxi into the city centre about 20min away costing you 15 euro. There is limited public transport, no shops as such near by except for a small deli that sells only drinks and snacks 200m away. A pizzeria/trattoria is located 500m or so down the street around the corner which opens from 7.30pm-10pm.To go sight seeing you need more than a guide and reliable transport. The rooms in the hotel are satisfactory, clean, comfortable, extra single bed comes in handy, mini bar fridges are empty. The view from the balcony varies depending in which room you are-from views of a primary school playground to the vatican dome in the distance. Staff are not very organized or friendly. On each occasion there has always been only one young gentleman who has been very helpful. The porters are not very good in handling your luggage and it is often misplaced on different floors. The best thing about Pineta Palace is the breakfast buffet. The bar and elegant restaurant open at inconvenient times and the prices are too expensive. If you get hungry during the day or late at night –goodluck. Whilst you wait for your hunger to surpass, you can relax on the sunbathing chairs outside in a secluded area.

Reviews.Title: “cosmos best of italy”
Reviews.Author: fgrup
Reviews.Content: the hotel is far from every tourist place in rome. also not on the main road. the king and queen bed are few. the walls are paper thin so you cannot sleep at night unless you are sedated or intoxicated. To see Rome walk down to main road, cross the rd and take bus no. 146 to Battistini. there is metro station there. u can see it from the bus on your left big letter M in red.the bus cum metro ticket can be brought from hotel. in metro take the map and the tourist places like st. Peters square, spanish steps, trevi fountain all fall on this line. take care of all your belongings in Rome.lot of stealing. the hotel side lane opens on the main rd adjacent to AGIP gas station. cross the rd and there is SMA super store. try the only restraunt on this rd. cheap and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BluEyesofJoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2007, with a tour. The hotel is out of the way and difficult to find. It is however, quiet. The hotel itself is a bit outdated; the rooms are average European size with thin walls and hard beds. Breakfast was plentiful and in a very large room. I would have prefered to stay more in town, but this place was fine.

Reviews.Title: “pineta palce not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: getaboutalotwales
Reviews.Content: stayed as part of cosmos italian masterpiece tour.pineta palace situated in a smart residential part of rome.plenty of little restaurants nearby.Staff very friendly rooms clean and modern.nice under used outside dining area.bar prices a steep even for rome.Dinner disappointing.Not a bad hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: Pennden
Reviews.Content: I'd give this 2.5 stars actually. I was part of a large group tour - which this hotel caters to quite well (bus parking, large dining room, etc). The location is outside the city center of course but not by too much. The immediate area is walkable and seemed pleasant. We had 3 nights here, and all were fairly comfortable. The rooms are decent sized and all have balconies which was a nice bonus from earlier hotels on the tour. The walls are DEFINITELY thin so be prepared... and our room at times smelled like a public restroom, although judging from the sounds we heard through the walls next door perhaps that was the source of the smell (ewww). In general the halls and doors seem tired - a bit like a college dorm. Air conditioning worked well enough despite the usual restrictions (shuts off at night). The bathroom is average at best with an oversized sink that is very useable while on the toilet - strange. Breakfast was fine and the restaurant has lots of space. We had one group dinner there that was not so great, but we loved the coffee and the selection every day of fruits, sliced meats and cheeses, pastries, yogurt and cereal/granola. Some folks in the group had top floor rooms with great views of the Vatican and fantastic terraces - a great place to relax at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “don't sweat the small stuff”
Reviews.Author: initaly
Reviews.Content: As most who stay here, we were with a bus tour. Cosmos, Best of Italy. We knew what to expect from reading tripadvisor. Yes the walls are very thin. Gravol works well to help sleep. The early mornings have most in bed before midnight anyway. Odd little bathroom. You can sit on the toilet, and do your laundry at the same time. Use the very convenient shuttle for 4 euros. It takes you into the heart of Rome and very close to Constantinis, the best wine/spirit store in Rome. A must. Pack a lunch from the breakfast buffet. We did this almost every day. Saves a lot of money and time. Rolls with meat and cheese, fruit, pastries, whatever. Make sure you bring baggies from home in various sizes for just this sort of thing. There is a laundry close by, but you would have to ask the locals for directions, the tour guide and hotel staff do not know anything of their surroundings. There are two grocery stores close by. One every one knows about, the other, which we liked better is not so well known. If you turn right and go to the very end of the street, past where the cars can go, turn right on the main drag and go down the hill. The grocery store has a green and white sign and is in a little gully off the parking lot. It is very new and nice. The hotel is only a place to sleep, and shower. Step outside and walk. If for no other reason, to stalk up on your favorite wine for the evening and/or next day.

Reviews.Title: “10 Northern lasses were impressed by the Palace”
Reviews.Author: ChiantiSister
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day trip with friends all celebrating a milestone birthday!! The hotel staff were great, impeccable English , very accommodating to any information requests. Their local knowledge was excellent. The little hopper bus service was super..if sometimes running later than expected. The hotel location was a good way out of the hustle of the centre of Rome.This suited our party really well. We had all read the previous reviews and were confused by the mix, however it does deserve to be a 4 star hotel the rooms were lovely well appointed and furnished fine. The breakfast room was fantastic with a huge choice of foods, fruits, juices, pastries etc. Would recommend it without question for anyone wanting to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pineta Palace”
Reviews.Author: cleowc
Reviews.Content: Very average 2 star hotel. Stayed as part of a cosmos tour. The rooms on the top floors appear to be better. We had a top floor room at the start of the tour that had a balcony with a view to the vatican. On our return at end of the tour we had a first floor room above the kitchen,noise from air conditioning, the kitchen, rooms above, below and next to you. The place must have paper thin walls and the vinyl floors wouldn't help. No tea or coffee making facilities which must be a prerequisit for cosmos because only one hotel included in the tour had such facilities. Its a good half hour walk the nearest metro (Battistini) or you can catch a bus to Cornelia station. There is a courtesy bus run from the hotel to Rome and one return trip to the hotel iin the evening. This is strictly a place to sleep and leave, as long as there are no school tours staying on your night or you can forget the sleep part as well. Paper thin walls!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCart
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful for the most part. The lady who worked at at the bar in the evenings was not very friendly, however. The restaurant's food was mediocre. The rooms were reasonable and a decent size for a European hotel. The worst part was the location - you had to take a bus from the hotel to the metro station and then take the metro to the city centre...it took about 35-40 minutes to get to the city centre on average depending on the wait time at the bus stop. For the price, it was ok. I paid $114 US from Hotwire. I would try to find a hotel closer to the metro station to avoid the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: LadyDar
Reviews.Content: Absolute outstanding customer service by the Front Desk Staff. After confusion at our original booked Hotel, the Staff at this Hotel came through with 3 rooms at 3 am in the morning(we looked for 5 hours after our origianl Hotel bombed on confirmed reservations). They could not be more accomadating- upgrading my husband and I to a business suite and My father and sister in law to deluxe singles. Breakfast-standard fare, don't get your heart set on good egg dishes and it is very crowded. Get down there early. Location? It is a expensive Taxi anywhere but if you are traveling as a group of 2 or more it is affordable by Rome standards. Convenient shuttle to St. Peter's area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Ermm..”
Reviews.Author: The_Penguins
Reviews.Content: What on earth have we got ourselves in to here? I know, I know I should have paid more attention to the reviews on here, but for some reason my sensible head was having a day off. Right, we booked to stay at the Pina Colada Palace for one night before our return from Italy via Fiumicino airport. Here is a tip for all reading this, DONT DO THE SAME! Upon first entering the hotel it takes a while for the full horror of the situation to hit you, but you soon realise what the place reminds you of. If any of you were unlucky enough to be caught up in the great Costa Del Rubbish package tour boom of the 80s you will start to get a feeling of familiarity as the surroundings of the Pint Of Vomit Palace begin to assault your senses. If I am being completley honest the lobby and bar area of the hotel that you are first met with could be very nice if some money was spent on updating the decor and facilities. It is a nice size and is quite nice to sit in to relax, just close your eyes! Now I think about it, we should have stayed in the reception area, (with our eyes closed of course), and not ventured up to "The Room". I write it like that because it felt like we were in an 80s horror movie. And a note to make here is, who had the idea to put a strip of carpet halfway up the walls?? We entered the room and were met with worn out furniture, which looked like it was probably never nice in the first place. The walls were a lovely shade of peach, the bedding was white and blue and thinner than my hair and the bathroom was trying to burst out from its surroundings, not dirty, (which is a pet hate of mine), but not clean, especially the shower curtain. A nice touch in the bathroom was the way you had to slide yourself underneath the oversized sink to sit on the toilet which was actually underneath the sink.....madness! The wall behind the desk (or whatever it was supposed to be) had been dented and scraped with the desk like object but not repaired. The television looked it was also trying to escape but via a different method, it was trying to fly away, perhaps being near the airport had given it ideas. The balcony was smashing, at least as far as it was outside, although I cant help thinking that it was originally a feature of the bathroom that had actually managed to escape. I wish I had taken some pictures of the room so I could relay the full horror to you but I didnt want to damage the camera. Anyway, we managed to get back in to the centre of Rome that evening for dinner and decided to have too much to drink so we wouldnt notice the room when we got home. Breakfast at the Please Release Me Palace was at least in the morning, and that's the best thing I can say about it. The juice tasted of Tarmac, the other flavour of juice was actually orange squash, the croissants were once cardboard boxes and the cooked breakfast was cooked three weeks ago last Tuesday. Oh, I forgot about the lunch that we had the previous day from the bar. Breeze blocks with some (virtually tasteless) ham and cheese in the middle, delicious! But, even though the staff are at best, unsmiling and a bit grumpy (well wouldn't you be, working there?!) at least one receptionist was fluent in three languages at least so she should have no problems understanding your complaints. Anyway, to sum up, this place is a waste of space, it needs to be demolished, it is beyond help, it is a blot on the landscape of one of the most beautiful cities in the world, it has no redeeming features, other than you can at least leave if you do find yourself there by mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from everything”
Reviews.Author: HEATHROWHONEY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated 5 star and it was too, it was too far out of rome central but the hotel was good and very clean. you could catch a courtsey bus for a small charge to centre of rome but it was a pain to have to keep on doing this rather than just walk to all amenties. the people in hotel were very professional and the cocktails were to die for, also the latte coffee was out of this world. not for teenages or small children mainly a break for couples as the walking catching busses etc too much for kids. no pool indoor or out so that was a downer but we made good of our time there and will always remeber it with love.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KenRuth
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 7 day vacation from Rome and stayed exclusively at the Hotel Pineta Palace. I read all the reviews and came away scared at what people were saying. Yet when I arrived it was nothing of the sort. The staff were courteous, bilingual, and easy to access. Sure it is not a luxury hotel but well worth the price I paid for my wife and I. The positives include a nice air conditioned room with a balcony, pleasant room service and breakfast, nice staff, and a superb shuttle service from the hotel into the city. The so called paper thin walls were mostly overexaggerated in my opinion. Sure at times you could hear the neighbors television on but not to the point that I could tell you what channel and what was showing. I slept perfectly and my wife is a light sleeper and she never missed one minute of her sleep. Not many negatives to report other than I got tired of eating the same breakfast every day, the eggs were more like soup. The distance to the city was a ways but the shuttle (4 euros) was well worth it and always available. The bathroom sink was a bit oversized but that's getting too picky in my opinion. The cleaning room service was excellent and always polite. If I had to go to Rome again I would definately book there again. It left a good taste in my mouth. When I left the desk service called a taxi for me and I was off. Check out was easy and painless. I recommend taking the shuttle every day rather than going to public transportation to get into the city. Rome is a beautiful place but hot in the summer. Try to take what Rome gives you. Good luck and happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Average room for an average price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews from other trip advisor members. I too would agree this is an average hotel, priced fairly, quite a distance into rome area but easily acceptable by transportation. Hotel staff was courteous. Walls were paper thin, so thin we could communicate to my inlaws through the walls. Breakfast was fair. Clean dining area and rooms. Overall, this hotel was everything I expected and I would recommend it to someone who is looking for a budget vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Replace the word Contemporary in describing this hotel with the word Basic!”
Reviews.Author: KADNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: Good points - The hotel does a superb buffet lunch including a choice of soft drink for 10 Euros. The have a shuttle bus that runs into Rome 7 times per day starting at 8.30am last return 22.00 they charge 4 Euros return for this service. Note it is the same cost if you only want to use it one way. The bus stops first at the Vatican and then into the City. It takes 20 minutes into the city. Bad Points - The walls are paper thin! If you are not an early riser avoid this hotel. Because as we experienced if the people in the next room want to be up at 5.30 you will be too and when they turn the hairdryer on it sounds like a pneumatic drill! I woke in the night and could hear the guy in the next room snoring! The rooms are very basic, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Too far”
Reviews.Author: Italy_06
Reviews.Content: On our next trip, we will be staying somewhere closer. We accesed city center/hotel by shuttle sometimes. Cost was 4 Euros per person. Same price roundtrip/one way. We only really needed it going back to hotel after shopping, and having too many things to carry. Otherwise we took bus to metro. Small amusement park nearby w/ bumper cars, arcade, swings, and bouncy gym for kids. My daughter really enjoyed that. Breakfast was okay, not great. Scrambled eggs were very watery. It was the same breakfast everyday. Would have liked some variety through week. Ate dinner there once, and that was very good, and reasonably priced. Beds were uncomfortable and hard. Shower is stand up, no tub and extremely small. Size of a small closet. Trying to give my 5 yr. old a shower was difficult, and almost impossible to keep the water in the shower. Sometimes it looked as though I had the shower instead of her. Walls are thin. Some front desk staff were a bit snobby. Would definitely recommend somewhere closer.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but better to be closer”
Reviews.Author: Nixsy
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was reasonably priced for a week and had a shuttle bus to the centre of Rome. This you had to pay for and only ran a couple of times a day. Taxi's cost us about 15 Euro to the Vatican - so an expensive week! Rooms were functional - battered furniture and not the most comfortable bed. Small balcony with view to Vatican (just). Had a TV - that was about it. No pool for kids, hotel seemed to be in a residential area with little to do in vicinity. We ate dinner there once, was OK, but breakfasts were much better and plenty to eat. I think I would invest in somewhere closer next time - save yourself the taxi fares!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you're resourceful”
Reviews.Author: EasternPA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there two nights beginning October 6th. Yes, the room was typically small (don't believe the pics linked here at Expedia - that's a suite), but the private porch nearly doubled the usable space. The hotel really is situated smack in the middle of a purely residential neighborhood, and is surprisingly quiet for being surrounded by thousands of apartments. While it is pretty far from the center of town, it is easily reachable via a combination of the Metro A Cornelia station and the 994 bus. Save your money and buy a 3-day unlimited bus/metro pass for 11 euros instead of paying for their twice-a-day shuttle. The trick is to get your pass at the Tabbachi at the railway station in FCO airport before heading into town, and figuring out where to get off the 994 bus the very first time (hint: wait for the roadway to split around buildings near the Hotel Beethoven, and get off where the two sides rejoin. Cross the street and walk up and thru the dead end street right into the hotel lobby - 150m in all). The bed was very firm and pillows too soft, with a noticeable split between the two twin mattresses. Not enough to ruin a few nights' sleep. Breakfast was just fine, even for an American traveler who enjoys a very full plate. We had dinner there one night during a thunderstorm, and service was pretty good, with nearly all guests speaking American English. I did feel like I was "played" regarding whether or not tips were included ("servizio compresa") in the meal bill, however. If I *must* complain about something, the walls really have zero sound deadening, and the room could have reclaimed some space from the bathroom by using a smaller sink and losing the bidet. Now that we're experts at the whole Metro A <-> 994 bus thing, we would definitely stay there again, if I'm the one paying the bill. This place was an excellent find for 100-150 euros per night less than other places closer to the center of town. Oh, and for the person who spent 55 euros for 2 calls to Brazil, you should have bought a phone card (thanks Let's Go Rome!) I bought a card for 10 euros that gave me 260 minutes to the USA so long as I logged into the card with a free call from my room instead of a payphone.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? I dont think so...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is not pratical at all for people who is going to Rome for holiday purposes. The hotel has a bus service, that take you to the center and bring you back at the schedule times, but you have to adjust your time to the bus schedule, what is not very nice when you are in holidays. The service is not too good, the reception staffs are a bit rude, showing not much interest in help you out with any enquire. The room doent look new at all, but the bathroom is ok. What really stressed me out was they charged because they charged 55,00 euros for 2 very quickly call that i made to Brasil... ok, it was a international call, but i did not spend more than 12 in the both calls toguether.

Reviews.Title: “Far but friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only place I have stayed in Rome, so hard to contextualise, however... Far out of the city, but does run a shuttle bus (I didn't try this). The desk staff were extremely helpful, giving (good) maps & advice on buses, the metro and taxis. I could not fault the service they gave, which was the best part of the hotel. Otherwise ok but not remarkable. Breakfast adequate but not inspiring. However I must say that the balcony rooms have views over the city that are quite spectacular. I would try and stay somewhere closer in next time, if I could get a comparable price. However, with taxis from the centre around 11 Euros, this would still be a contender.

Reviews.Title: “Pineta Palace hotel was very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Jacs58
Reviews.Content: The Pineta Palace was really good value for money. I had booked this hotel before reading other reviews. I was pleasantly surprised with everything about the hotel. The breakfast had plenty of variety to choose from. The small bar does lovely club sandwiches(too much for me to eat). Our rooms were clean and spacious. The bathroom was also clean with plenty of room. The hotel itself was modern and stylish. The location was a long way out of Rome (about half an hour by road on the curtesy bus). We found this service invaluable. For only 4 euros return this was good value and time saving.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near the Heart of Rome in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Lambrias
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from spending 4 days in Rome having stayed at the Pineta Palace Hotel, having read the reviews on this website before going. Having only just returned we consider the previous negative feedback to be very harsh. We stayed in a standard room on the 4th floor and our balcony had a magnificent view of St.Peters Dome at the Vatican. Having a balcony overlooking Rome truly was a bonus for us. Furthermore, the Hotel has a very secure car park with cctv video link to security to open and close the elctric gates every time you take your car in and out of the Hotel. Furthermore, with parking in Rome being somewhat difficult the car park is a real bonus. The morning buffet was ok, and considering the price we paid for our room (which included breakfast) was again a bonus as in many hotels of this standard you would expect to pay extra. The standard of cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff was excellent, and the coach service provided by the hotel (4 euro cost) leaving about 6/7 times a day? took the away the strain of driving into the centre, and finding the hotel on your return. The tv was all italian except mtv, and a bbc,cnn,sky chanel would have been desirable. We could hear shuffling of chairs etc as walls were somehat thin, but it wasnt really a problem. There are 2 excellent restaurants within walking distance, though they do take a little finding, but staff were ever so helpful to us, especially as we could have eaten in the hotel (which we did not). I would trully recomend this hotel again. Only bad point was that it was hard to find. It is in a residential area, however, it was quiet and not noisy as some of the hotels in the centre probably are.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were here for two different nights with our tour group on our honeymoon. The lobby is beautiful and we were excited until we got to our twin bed room! We asked for a double and the man at the desk said no. We ended up swapping with a mother/daughter who got a double bed! The room is minimal, the a/c turned off by itself overnight leaving the room stifling by morning, and the light switch near the door didn't wire to anything in the room! We too, were upset with the noise level as we were able to watch CNN without the sound on because the man in the next room had it on as well. Having just come from Gran Paradiso is Sorrento (EXCELLENT!) where a free shuttle ran 7 times a day, we were a bit surprised to pay 4 Euro a piece for a shuttle that left us in Rome for either 3 hours or 5. However, we had a delicious sandwich and fries at the cafe in the lobby (but it took 35 minutes, so don't order if you're in a hurry!).

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel if you don't plan on sleeping.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Finding the Hotel Pineta Palace in the first place is the scariest ordeal about this hotel. It would probably be best to ride the Metro to the Cornelia stop on the A Line and do yourself a favor and get a cab for the rest of the journey. We tried taking the bus, went the wrong direction and then fnally after getting on another bus, the driver dropped us off in the area, but we had no idea from then on where the hotel was. In fact, a sign on the main road is misleading and would take you away from the motel. Even a taxi driver noticed us and took time to stop to tell us we were walking the wrong way. Once you get there the transportation is easy as they offer a very inexpensive shuttle service to the Vatican and to downtown. We had read reviews that the staff here was rude or grumpy. We found NO one like this at all. From the two ladies in the bar where we ordered some pretty good food, to the waiters in their excellent restaurant where we had a delightful dinner, to the very helpful staff at the desk, who I made a point to be polite too, all responded as equally polite. Come up to these people and ask them how they are and you will get a much better reception than others who complained about them being unpleasant. There is also a wonderful authentic Italian restaurant just up the street a few blocks from the hotel. My sister and I were the only non locals there. When you come out of the hotel lobby to the right is a road and a residential parking lot. Take the road (don't head in the direction of the parking lot)down about six or seven blocks. The restaurant is excellent and the service was very good. It is actually quite large inside, but we chose to sit under the outside awning. The food was reasonably priced too. You can't go wrong here. I am not one to rip a place apart and I feel like I see the good in most hotels and so I just gave credit where it was due. Our room was clean and comfortable and I didn't have a issue with the stool being too close to the sink like others have in these reviews. Some people plainly have nothing nice to say about a place and everything has to be kept in perspective here. But now for the unpleasant part......The room noise at night was purely unbearable. We could hear the guy next door coughing like he was standing in the room. People roamed up and down the halls on their cell phones at all hours of the night talking in their normal voices that sounded like they were right by the bed. As many have written before.....the walls are paper, paper, paper thin. If you are a light sleeper, you will be a non sleeper. My sister sat up in the lobby all night because of the noise coming from everywhere. People kept moving furniture across the tile floors above us at ridiculous hours of the night. The experience was horrible. This would have been a fine hotel if it weren't for the inabilty to sleep. That is why you stay in a motel, because you are dog tired from running around all day and you need sleep to re-energize for the next day. Unless you are in a coma, you will not sleep in this hotel. Period. Take along some Ambien if you plan on staying at the Pineta Palace.

Reviews.Title: “OK facilities but the location is bad.”
Reviews.Author: St._Simons_Dad
Reviews.Content: Like most Italian hotels, they made us rent 2 rooms for our family of 5. When we arrived, the rooms were not near each other and one of them smelled terribly of cigarette smoke. We begged for a change of rooms and got one closer to our other room. The front desk clerks seemed a bit unpleasant. Our kids affectionately named them "Helga and the Burgermeister." The lobby was a little more spacious than most European hotels. The hotel was extremely hard to find. We kept our car parked in the convenient parking garage under the hotel. We used taxis and the shuttle to get us into town. We once walked to the little pizza restaurant roughly a quarter mile away, which was the only eatery within walking distance. The hotel had an OK restaurant though. The view was of the old apartment buildings nearby and the entire surroundings were generally distasteful. The typical European breakfast fare was not liked by the others in my family, but I liked it. Thankfully we purchased Expedia's cancellation coverage. We cut our stay from 3 nights down to 2 because we wanted to leave Rome and see other places. We'll consider many other hotels before we go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the Pinetal Palace with my son from a 5 day break, I found the hotel nice, no problem with the staff, It is a little out of the way but they do a good shuttle service leaving different times throughout the day and the same on the return,only once the shuttle failed to appear but the hotel gave us all free drinks as it was our last day or they give you free tickets for it, normal cost 8 euros. The taxis we found were a very reasonable price about 10 euros for a return trip from the city, i was very worried after reading a lot of the reviews about this hotel but we were very pleasently surprised.

Reviews.Title: “The People in Roach Motels in America are 100% Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pineta Palace for our honeymoon trip with COSMOS. Early one morning, our group ate breakfast in the dining room and I laid my bag under our table during the meal. When we left, I forgot the bag with my credit cards, digital camera and drivers license. Within a half-hour of our leaving, our tour guide called the hotel to report the bag and we returned. The wait staff diligently denied knowing anything about it and they said no other hotel guests had been to the dining room, which made us believe someone on staff had taken the bag. If it hadn't been for our tour guide's prodding, the front desk staff would not have even called us a taxi to the police station to report the theft (that's another pathetic story). But further, our tour guide somewhat defended these people by suggesting that gypsies may have stolen the bag! My husband observed that, if gypsies are that prevalent in the hotel, perhaps we should not leave our luggage outside of our room doors for pickup as COSMOS told us to do. The tour guide just stared at him, unable to provide an answer. Aside from the Pope, Rome can be an evil city with evil opportunists who work at Pineta Palace. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay at the pineta palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay in rome ,the hotel was lovely ,the room was a great size ,cleaned daily with fresh towels.reception staff were very helpful giving map of streets in rome .the hotel was a bit out of town but easy to get bus to metro station ,10mins on bus and 10 mins on metro to get to centre of rome.the breakfast in the hotel was excellent lots of choice,selection of cereal,hot and cold buffet style.no complaints at all. great value for money,will certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quite far from the centre but good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pineta Palace is certainly not a 4 star hotel. Although Italian hotels are generally less comfortable than other hotels with the same star rating in Europe, Pineta Palace does definitely not stand for "luxury". The location is ok, although it is VERY hard to find when going there the first time and not taking a taxi. So make sure you have some detailed travel information with you. There are some bus stops close to the hotel, most busses have service until midnight. Nevertheless you can also walk from metro station "Battistini" (served by night bus) and you will reach the hotel within 15 minutes. But still, with bus and metro, you will need 30 - 40 minutes to reach Termini station. Nevertheless, the surrounding area of the hotel is quite nice, a bit hilly and a beautiful view to the Vatican city. There is a big street very close to the hotel, but you don`t really recognize any noise. The rooms were fine, considering that we paid around 70 euro a night. The most annoying thing to me was that they did not have adaptors for my standard european plug. I couldn´t charge my mobile. For any Italian, this would have meant a severe catastrophe, if you know what I mean;-) The bed was comfortable and the room was big enough for 2 persons. I did not hear any noises from other rooms or from the floor. The bathroom was ok, although it looked as it had not been renovated within the last 15 years. The breakfast was a very funny experience, as you could see Italian "hospitality" at its best. The staff did not speak English and the staff were very slow. Although it is a breakfast buffett, they did not manage to clean up tables and to provide new cups and glasses. The food was standard, forutantely not an Italian but a real breakfast. So it was definitely not the most delightful stay I had in Italy, but in comparison to other Rome hotels (especially the overpriced shabby ones in the Termini area), Pineta Palace was a bargain. Don´t expect a 4 star standard! Make sure you don`t book rooms via the hotel but rather watch out for a good offer on the web.

Reviews.Title: “Left in Hadrian's Villa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The trip to Rome is wonderful, but everything about the room is true. I could hear a baby crying four doors down. I could hear someone on the other side of the shower, I may as well have taken a shower with them because if I had talked, they would have been able to listen. Do not go on the tour to Hadrian's Villa!!! My wife and I started by leaving our hotel to go to the tour company's main bus station.
