At that point our hotel had reserved us a spot, so I was paying the bill with a credit card and my wife used the restroom. I saw that my shoe was untied and put it on a row of seats inside the tour company's office. The row of seats were so rittled with cigarette burns I had no problem putting my foot on them to tie my shoe, then all of a sudden, a Dutch speaking woman went crazy in her foreign language I'm guessing that I was crude for putting my foot on a cigarette burned chair??? to tie my shoe. She was from the Hilton and quite a bit snobby from what I saw. Then we get on the bus and go to Hadrian's villa where we almost run uphill all the way for ten minutes, and look at a few sites, then I stop at a restroom and our tour and tourguide were gone. We went downhill and found nobody there. Our bus was gone far before we thought any tour here would have been over. We looked at all the buses in the lot and were told that our bus was at a bar/cafe and then I realized they Left Us Behind. If anyone over 50 yrs. old doesn't have a myocardial infarction on this tour I would be very surprised and happy. It cost 70 euro for a taxi to St. Peters, and 10 Euro to our hotel from there. All the while, the mercedes taxi was about 100 times better for a tour and a tour guide than it was on Hadrian's Villa Tour to Tivoli with our guide. Don't go on Vastours to Tivoli.

Reviews.Title: “Poor and difficult location”
Reviews.Author: fireshep
Reviews.Content: I thought we were prepared for the Pineta when we learned it was booked on our first ever Cosmos tour. We weren't. There was not much to be happy with....and we are use to European economy type hotels. The staff was generally not helpful, but even more of an issue was the location. It is NOT convenient to any public transportation no matter what you are told. If you take the subway, which is suggested, it is VERY difficult to find a connecting bus to the Pineta area. If you actually do find the bus (congratulations!), it will drop you off on a highway and I can only suggest you find the nearby hospital (back down the highway and off the road)for directions to the Pineta. Nothing is marked. Of course, our first attempt was at night which added to the problem, but we have pretty good savvy with such things. Maybe a better option would be to take the bus all the way. Also, the early hotel risers can be easily heard thru the walls. On the plus side, one of the desk clerks who was willing to help us suggested a nearby restaurant to walk to...and the meal was quite good for the price. I think it was probably the only nearby restaurant. I would recommend trying a find a different hotel if you are going to be dependant on public transportation. And if you are on a Cosmos type tour and like to have some independance, good luck. A taxi from the Termini cost us 28Euros including tip. Of course, bear in mind our driver hit 100KM on the streets of Rome making it a quick trip. A thrilling ride only in retrospect, once we realized we survived it.

Reviews.Title: “Group loved the Pineta Palace!”
Reviews.Author: midubay
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a group of five couples, who do a lot of traveling, and all were very happy with the Pineta Palace. We had also read the reviews, but found the staff kind and accommodating. The location is not in the city center, but we found the hotel shuttle very reasonable and taxi rates were not bad. The breakfast is excellent and the hotel restaurants served wonderful food and were not over priced. We especially loved the food in the lounge off the lobby. The staff that worked that area were great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to have a convenient location to the vatican, shopping areas and really get a good value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Global_Indian
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before going to Rome, and was surprised by how accurate people have been with their observations. Yes the hotel is far from the centre of town and the walls are exremely thin. But yet, given the price we paid for the room, it was excellent value for money. The main problem with the hotel is the distance. The metro ride to Aurelia station is quite quick, but waiting for a bus to the hotel is a bit of a hassle as the services are not very frequent. On an average we waited around 15-20 mins. I suggest you buy a day metro/bus pass as you will need it just to get to and from the hotel. Given the distance we were not able to stay very late in the centre of town and enjoy Rome's nightlife. The breakfast was excellent! It did not vary, but for a couple of days its fine. We never ate at the hotel restuarants, but I believe they are expensive. The rooms were clean and well maintained, but apart from CNN there is no other English channel on the television. Dont try room service as nobody ever picks up the phone! Overall the hotel offered excellent value for money, but the next time I would stay much closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked through the Epedia site. The site doesn't allow you to search by price-you have to specify the destination at the start-when you may simply wish to get away. The Hotel was rated at 4 stars but was clearly not a 4 star. The hotel had a very small bar. The whole hotel looked tired and shabby. We selected a deal that offered meals/drinks included-we were only offered 1 choice at the hotel restaurant. This was not a vegetarian option (I'm vegetarian)-we had to argue for the drinks and were only finally given an aperitif. The deal also included welcome drinks and a basket of fruit-these weren't forthcoming. The deal boasted that an American buffet was included. This was available to all and not shown on the standard price info. There was no evidence of the Piano Bar mentioned on the web page. The area we assume was the Piano Bar was being used as the restaurant in the evenings. If we'd know how poor the hotel restaurant was, and what a fuss we'd have to face-being marched upstairs to argue with the manager-we'd have just taken B&B. The restaurant included on the second day (Valentino), was excellent and cannot be faulted but the web page should make it absolutely clear what is included, and that you will have no choice in what you eat at the hotel. There was a low cost bus available into town but it had very limited space and filled up quickly. The bus only ran during the day so a taxi was needed every night. The hotel was very remote and situated in a residential area-not at all practical for Rome sightseeing, and without sufficient reasonable quality amenities to make it a viable option to stay at the hotel to relax. The nearest Metro station was some way away, and being worked on, so taxi fares formed the bulk of our holiday costs.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ccbrasil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, in a residential area but if your room have the promissed view of St. Peter you will also be kept awake all night because the hotel is located between the 2 major hospitals in Rome, and ambulances arrive there non stop. The service was ppoor, the floors wheren't cleaned during the 4 days we stayed. The hotel has got a executive floor that they call 7th heaven, oh well, lucky me i was on the 8th hell. The bed linen is so old and ruff that up until today i still trying to cure the rashes on my skin The shuttle service is very limited and unless you enjoy having to look at your watch all the time to make sure you are back in time to catch your shuttle you are better off paying a bit more and staying in the city. you will also need to take cabs and this will add up on your expenses. The hotel can not be a 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: dptoursusa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pineta twice on Cosmos tours in March 2002 and October 2004. The location is remote but the hotel is clean and modern without the traffic noise that I have encountered at other more centrally located Rome hotels. I found the addition of a hotel shuttle bus to St. Peter's and Cavour Square to be an inexpensive alternative to having to depend on taxis or public transportation. The shuttle service was quite dependable considering the traffic congestion. Rooms were always ready upon arrival from the airport. The buffet breakfasts are the best I've encountered in Italy. The restaurant is on the expensive side but we had a couple sandwiches in the bar area for an acceptable alternative. There are a couple pizza restaurants a block or two away and a great little family food market down the street. I was in a single both times and the rooms were quite big and noiseless. Some of the bath fixtures were oversized and made using the bathroom a chore. I had to put my legs under the sink to use one of the toilets while the bidet was free of obstacles. The front desk staff could be less stiff and more welcoming. Although the hotel may seem out of the way, it is still a good safe deal for Rome and is quite modern. Downtown hotels are not always as conveniently located as one might think.

HotelInfo.Name: Pineta Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Via San Lino Papa 35, 00167 Rome, Italy
